title: Similar type to Nofret Light
content:
Does anyone have any suggestions to type similar to Nofret Light? You can see it being used here [Graf Von Faber Castell](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171255/http:/www.graf-von-faber-castell.com/), although I can not find a similar web font for the life of me. The web font is listed as 'GVFC light' so I couldn't find it that way either.

Thanks!
author: dasikins

comments.content: Um, similar in what ways? In other words, why not just use Nofret light, which is easy to find with a simple Google search?

I would use Nofret, unfortunately it is not a web font. I was hoping to find some similar typefaces and then figure out if they offered a web font.

Actually, I couldn't find any useful information on google. I even used fonts.com and indentifyfont.com identify tools, but didn't come up with anything helpful. Hence, here I am.

Here is what I found on google below. Don't worry, I am actually trying to find the answer myself and not just coming straight here. My main goal was to find some individuals who are more knowledgeable regarding type then myself. I love it, but still have a lot to learn.

[Google search](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171255/https:/www.google.com/#q=Typefaces+similar+to+Nofret+)

Again I tested other key words to find stuff, but surprisingly I didn't not find much help.

Maybe someone can give you better information -- I'm not a web guy -- but in the meantime, try this

[http://shopthebbar.com/blog/what-the-font-web-fonts-vs-desktop-fonts-draft/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171255/http:/shopthebbar.com/blog/what-the-font-web-fonts-vs-desktop-fonts-draft/ "http://shopthebbar.com/blog/what-the-font-web-fonts-vs-desktop-fonts-draft/")

Diotima is another Gudrun Zapf von Hesse font that shares many characteristics.

See:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Diotima/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171255/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Diotima/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Diotima/fonts/")
